citation.article-title: Defluviimonas denitrificans gen. nov., sp. nov., and Pararhodobacter aggregans gen. nov., sp. nov., non-phototrophic Rhodobacteraceae from the biofilter of a marine aquaculture

p.s: Description of D. denitrificans, sp. nov.
id="par0065">D. denitrificans (de.ni.tri’fi.cans. N.L. part. adj. denitrificans, denitrifying)
Displays the following characters in addition to those given in the genus description above.
Cells are 0.5 μm wide and 1.1–1.9 μm long.
Colonies are yellowish, translucent, 0.5–1.0 mm in diameter.
Grows from 10–40 °C and pH 5.5–9.0; optimal growth at 30–40 °C and pH 6.5–7.0.
Doubling time under optimal conditions is strain-specific, 4.6–4.8 h.
No salt requirement, grows at up to 5% NaCl.
Grows on acetate, alanine, butyrate, casamino acids, cellobiose, fructose, fumarate, glutamate, lactate, malate, maltose, mannose, propionate, rhamnose, and succinate.

Growth not apparent on amygdaline, arabinose, asparagine, butanol, citrate, ethanol, glucose, inositol, lactose, mannitol, melibiose, methanol, oxalate, peptone, propanol, pyruvate, saccharose, sorbitol, tartrate, and xylose.
Gelatine is hydrolyzed.
Acetoine or indol not formed.
Beta-galactosidase and tryptophane deaminase positive.
Urease, lysine and ornithine decarboxylase, and arginine dihydrolase negative.
Oxygen, nitrate, and nitrite used as electron acceptors; end product of denitrification is N2.
Sulfate and iron (III) not used as electron acceptors.
The predominant quinone is Q10.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18:1ω7c (82.9%), C18:0 (4.6%), and C18:0 3-OH (3.7%).
The type strain (D9-3T = DSM 18921T = ATCC BAA-1447T) was isolated from a fluidized bed reactor, which was part of the biofilter of a recirculating marine aquaculture system in Rehovot, Israel.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 65.1 mol%.

A second strain (D11-58 = DSM19039 = ATCC BAA-1448) was isolated from the same source and differed only slightly by its fatty acid profile, its broader salt optimum, slower doubling time, and by being motile.
